intro: Saurauia temburongensis, commonly known as the Temburong saurauia, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within the understorey of tropical forests. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
